SENT.plain: Posterior helical pits are an easily overlooked finding
They are uncommon in the general population although they do occur as an isolated autosomal dominant trait
We have observed posterior helical pits as a feature in three syndromes only: Beckwith-Wiedemann syndrome, Simpson-Golabi-Behmel syndrome and Rubinstein-Taybi syndrome
We suggest that posterior helical pits, when present, are an excellent diagnostic handle
